intro: Junellia mulinoides, commonly known as the slender junellia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and a distinctive central column. Junellia mulinoides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
